questions.prompt: At the 2008 Beijing Olympics, which athlete won a record eight gold medals in a single Games?
questions.explanation: Michael Phelps won eight gold medals at the 2008 Olympics, the most ever by an athlete at a single Games.

questions.prompt: Which MLB player set the single-season home run record by hitting 73 in 2001?
questions.explanation: Barry Bonds hit 73 home runs in 2001, the MLB single-season record.

questions.prompt: Wilt Chamberlain’s 100-point NBA game (March 2, 1962) was played at which arena?
questions.explanation: Chamberlain’s 100-point game was played at Hershey Sports Arena in Hershey, Pennsylvania.

questions.prompt: Who won the Golden Boot at the 1990 FIFA World Cup (as top scorer)?
questions.explanation: Italy’s Salvatore Schillaci finished as the 1990 World Cup top scorer and won the Golden Boot.

questions.prompt: Who holds the record for the fastest Premier League hat-trick (2 minutes 56 seconds, 2015)?
questions.explanation: Sadio Mané set the Premier League record for fastest hat-trick (2:56) for Southampton vs Aston Villa in 2015.

questions.prompt: The longest match in major tennis history (Isner vs Mahut, Wimbledon 2010) lasted how long?
questions.explanation: John Isner vs Nicolas Mahut at Wimbledon 2010 lasted 11 hours 5 minutes.

questions.prompt: Which F1 driver set the record for most consecutive Grand Prix wins in a single season with 10 in 2023?
questions.explanation: Max Verstappen set the single-season consecutive-wins record with 10 straight victories in 2023.

questions.prompt: Which riders are tied for the most overall Tour de France general classification wins (five each)?
questions.explanation: Jacques Anquetil, Eddy Merckx, Bernard Hinault, and Miguel Indurain are tied with five Tour de France GC wins.

questions.prompt: Who set the men’s 100m freestyle long-course world record of 46.91 seconds in 2009?
questions.explanation: César Cielo set the 100m freestyle world record (46.91) at the 2009 World Championships.

questions.prompt: As of December 24, 2025, who holds the NFL record for the longest made field goal (68 yards)?
questions.explanation: Cam Little set the NFL record with a 68-yard field goal in 2025 (surpassing the prior record of 66).

questions.prompt: Which NHL player holds the record for most points in a single season with 215 (1985–86)?
questions.explanation: Wayne Gretzky scored 215 points in 1985–86, the NHL single-season record.

questions.prompt: Usain Bolt’s world record in the men’s 100 metres is 9.58 seconds. Where did he set it?
questions.explanation: Bolt set the 9.58 world record in Berlin at the 2009 World Championships.

questions.prompt: Which MLB player holds the modern-era record for the longest hitting streak at 56 games (1941)?
questions.explanation: Joe DiMaggio’s 56-game hitting streak in 1941 is the MLB record.

questions.prompt: Who achieved the first tennis “Golden Slam” (all four majors + Olympic gold in the same year)?
questions.explanation: Steffi Graf completed the first Golden Slam in 1988 by winning all four majors and Olympic gold.

questions.prompt: Which goalkeeper remains the only one to have won the Ballon d’Or?
questions.explanation: Lev Yashin won the Ballon d’Or in 1963 and remains the only goalkeeper to do so.

questions.prompt: Who won the inaugural Cricket World Cup (1975) by defeating Australia in the final at Lord’s?
questions.explanation: West Indies won the 1975 Cricket World Cup, beating Australia in the final at Lord’s.

questions.prompt: Who was named MVP of Super Bowl I?
questions.explanation: Packers QB Bart Starr was the MVP of Super Bowl I.

questions.prompt: Who holds the MLB record for consecutive games played with 2,632?
questions.explanation: Cal Ripken Jr. played 2,632 consecutive games, the MLB record.

questions.prompt: Which racehorse became the first to complete the “Grand Slam” of the Triple Crown plus the Breeders’ Cup Classic (2015)?
questions.explanation: American Pharoah completed the first Triple Crown + Breeders’ Cup Classic ‘Grand Slam’ in 2015.

questions.prompt: What is the recognized fastest tennis serve (male), and who hit it?
questions.explanation: Guinness recognizes Sam Groth’s 263 km/h serve (2012) as the fastest recorded male tennis serve.

questions.prompt: Which pitcher threw the only perfect game in World Series history (1956, Game 5)?
questions.explanation: Don Larsen threw a perfect game for the Yankees against the Dodgers in the 1956 World Series (Game 5).

questions.prompt: Which pitcher set the modern MLB single-season strikeout record with 383 in 1973?
questions.explanation: Nolan Ryan struck out 383 batters in 1973, the modern-era single-season record.

questions.prompt: In Super Bowl XXV (Giants vs Bills), how many turnovers were committed by the two teams combined?
questions.explanation: Super Bowl XXV was notable for having zero turnovers by either team.

questions.prompt: Who won the 1930 FIFA World Cup final, defeating Argentina 4–2 in Montevideo?
questions.explanation: Uruguay won the inaugural World Cup in 1930, beating Argentina 4–2 in the final.

questions.prompt: Wimbledon introduced a final-set tiebreak at 12–12 starting in 2019. Who won the 2019 men’s final decided by that rule?
questions.explanation: Djokovic beat Federer in the 2019 Wimbledon final, which ended 13–12 in the fifth set after a 12–12 tiebreak.

questions.prompt: Who won the first modern Olympic marathon at Athens 1896?
questions.explanation: Spyridon (Spyros) Louis won the inaugural modern Olympic marathon at the 1896 Games in Athens.

questions.prompt: Which NBA player recorded a quadruple-double with 34 points, 10 rebounds, 10 assists, and 10 blocks on Feb. 17, 1994?
questions.explanation: David Robinson’s 1994 performance is one of only four recorded quadruple-doubles in NBA history.

questions.prompt: Which player scored a record 13 goals at a single FIFA World Cup (1958)?
questions.explanation: France’s Just Fontaine scored 13 goals at the 1958 World Cup, the single-tournament record.

questions.prompt: Who is the youngest men’s singles champion in Wimbledon history (won in 1985 at age 17)?
questions.explanation: Boris Becker won Wimbledon in 1985 at 17, the youngest men’s singles champion at the Championships.

questions.prompt: Which NHL player set the fastest hat-trick record by scoring three goals in 21 seconds (1952)?
questions.explanation: Bill Mosienko scored three goals in 21 seconds in 1952, the NHL fastest hat-trick record.

questions.prompt: Who scored the fastest goal in a FIFA World Cup finals match (11 seconds, 2002)?
questions.explanation: Hakan Şükür scored after 11 seconds for Turkey vs Korea Republic at the 2002 World Cup.

questions.prompt: Who holds the record for the fastest ODI century (100) off 31 balls (2015)?
questions.explanation: AB de Villiers scored an ODI century off 31 balls in 2015, the record.

questions.prompt: Which driver remains Formula One’s only posthumous World Drivers’ Champion?
questions.explanation: Jochen Rindt was awarded the 1970 F1 title posthumously and remains the only posthumous champion.

questions.prompt: Who is the youngest winner of the Masters Tournament (age 21 years, 104 days in 1997)?
questions.explanation: Tiger Woods won the 1997 Masters at age 21 years, 104 days, the youngest champion.

questions.prompt: Who recorded the fastest triple-double in NBA history (14 minutes 33 seconds of court time, 2018)?
questions.explanation: Nikola Jokić recorded a triple-double in 14:33 of court time on Feb. 15, 2018 (Guinness record).

questions.prompt: Who became MLB’s first member of the 40–40 club (40 HR and 40 SB in a season) in 1988?
questions.explanation: José Canseco became the first 40–40 player in 1988.

questions.prompt: Which athlete was the first to win Olympic gold in the same individual event at four consecutive Games (discus)?
questions.explanation: Al Oerter won four consecutive Olympic discus gold medals (1956–1968), the first to do so in one event.

questions.prompt: Beijing became the first city to host both the Summer and Winter Olympics by hosting the Winter Games in which year?
questions.explanation: Beijing hosted the Winter Olympics in 2022 after hosting the Summer Olympics in 2008.

questions.prompt: Which MLB player set the single-season stolen base record with 130 in 1982?
questions.explanation: Rickey Henderson stole 130 bases in 1982, the MLB single-season record.

questions.prompt: What is the men’s mile world record, and who set it?
questions.explanation: Hicham El Guerrouj set the men’s mile world record of 3:43.13 in 1999.
